p: Paddy fields are important source of greenhouse gas emissions, and CH 4 emissions from paddy fields accounts for about 20% of global anthropogenic CH 4 emissions annually [ 1]. According to the Food and Agricultural Organization (FAO), due to the increasing human population, the rice yield needs to increase by 40% by the end of the 2030s [ 2]. This suggests that paddy fields will continue to be an important anthropogenic CH 4 source worldwide [ 3].
